ARABIC: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِى يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُّسْتَمِرٍّ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We unleashed a howling wind against them on a day of unremitting horror.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We let loose against them a violent roaring wind on a day of ill omen, continuous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We sent a tumultuous wind against them on a day of unremitting misfortune,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On an unfortunate day We sent upon them a continuous violent wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We indeed sent towards them a severe windstorm, on a day the ill luck of which lasted upon them forever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, We sent against them a violently cold (Sarsar) wind on a day of calamity, continuous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely We sent on them a tornado in a day of bitter ill-luck
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We loosed against them a wind clamorous in a day of ill fortune continuous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! We let loose on them a raging wind on a day of constant calamity,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We sent a raging wind against them on a day of continuous calamity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily We! We sent against them a raging Wind On a day of calamity continuous.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed We unleashed upon them an icy gale on an incessantly ill-fated day,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, We sent against them a furious wind of harsh voice on a day of evil omen and continuous calamity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And We sent against them a howling wind in a Day of continuous of ill fortune
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We unleashed upon them a screaming wind, on a day of unrelenting misery.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:19] Indeed We unleashed upon them a clamorous wind, intensely noisy, on a day of prolonged ill fortune, (nahsin mustamirr means) either one of continuous ill fortune, or one of severe ill fortune — and this was the last Wednesday of the month —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 628 (Lo! We let loose on them a raging wind) a cold wind, which is the west wind (on a day of constant calamity) a day of continuous calamity upon the young and the old,
